TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of robbery . On DATE the ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) ordered that the applicant be remanded in custody until DATE . It found that there were reasonable grounds – in particular , evidence from witnesses DATE for suspecting him of the offence charged . The court further noted that the applicant was liable to a statutory maximum sentence of DATE imprisonment . It also found that there was a risk that the applicant might tamper with evidence .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prolonged the applicant ’s detention until DATE . It considered that the reasons for keeping him in detention were still valid and the need to secure the proper conduct of the investigation justified holding him in custody . It referred to the likelihood of a severe sentence of imprisonment being imposed on the applicant . It also found that there was a risk that the applicant might tamper with evidence , given the nature of the charges against him and the fact that he had acted with other co - accused .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s detention was subsequently prolonged by ORG on unspecified dates . The courts’ decisions were based on Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , which lists grounds for pre - trial detention , such as , the risk that an accused will abscond or go into hiding or a justified fear that an accused will attempt to induce witnesses or co - defendants to give false testimony or to obstruct the proper course of proceedings by any other unlawful means .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant of CARDINAL counts of robbery and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG ( PERSON ) upheld the impugned judgment .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not lodge a cassation appeal .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s letter to the ORG dated DATE bears a stamp marked “ censored ” ( cenzurowano ) , “ the prosecutor ” ( prokurator ) followed by an illegible signature . It appears that the envelope in which that letter was sent had been cut open and subsequently resealed with adhesive tape . According to the postmark the letter was posted on DATE .

CARDINAL . The application form submitted by the applicant and dated DATE bears a stamp marked “ censored ” ( cenzurowano ) , “ the judge ” ( sędzia ) followed by an illegible signature . The envelope bears a stamp confirming that the applicant ’s letter was received for dispatch by the prison administration on DATE . However , according to the postmark the letter was not posted until DATE . It also appears that the envelope was cut open and subsequently resealed with adhesive tape .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law concerning the censorship of ORG correspondence is set out in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of Michta v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE .
